intro: Calochortus nudus, commonly known as the naked belladonna lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Calochortus, which includes a variety of spring-blooming plants often referred to as glory-of-the-snow or mariposa lilies. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Calochortus nudus has fibrous roots and produces showy, cup-shaped blooms that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
